medical_history.chief_complaint: Constant burning pain and vasomotor instability in both feet.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced symptoms after nontraumatic rhabdomyolysis secondary to smoking heroin. He reported constant burning pain in both feet that disturbed his daily activities and sleep. Symptoms included swelling and tenderness in both feet, which partially improved with warm water immersion.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked heroin; denied history of other substance use.
